03:00 - Mistake 3: Complexity of Markets

06:00 - Mistake 6: Overconfidence with Short Experience

   - Importance of experiencing different market conditions

08:00 - Mistake 7: Dunning-Kruger Effect

09:00 - Mistake 8: Looking for Reasons to Say No
   - Focusing on the best opportunities
   - Strong convictions loosely held

10:00 - Mistake 9: Avoiding Responsibility
   - Importance of taking ownership of trades
   - Speculative trades and accountability

11:00 - Mistake 10: Identifying as a Specific Type of Trader
   - Being flexible in trading strategies
   - Adapting to market conditions

12:00 - Mistake 11: Common Losing Habits
   - Disposition effect and naive reinforcement
   - Understanding common pitfalls

13:00 - Mistake 12: Beating the Market in Different Ways
   - Different approaches to outperforming the market
   - Importance of managing drawdowns

14:00 - Mistake 13: Abolishing Normal Thought Patterns
   - Avoiding bargain hunting in the market
   - Examples of market misconceptions

15:00 - Mistake 14: Avoiding Simple Explanations
   - Recognizing the complexity of markets
   - Importance of focusing on price movement

17:00 - Conclusion
   - Summary of key points
   - Invitation for viewer feedback and further discussion
